development:
Part 1 – Determine domain
Students need to understand how to determine the domain of a combined function. They will need to recognize that the domain of two or more combined functions is the intersection of the domain. (domain must be common to all functions). Have students determine domain of example 1 graphs then try to find the common domain between. Have them try to complete part b of example on their own.

Part 2 – Superposition Principle
Cover superposition principle with example. How to sketch a combined graph using two different graphs. It is a good idea to have students create the habit of forming a table of values for example 2 and 3 This will help with graphing of more complex functions.

Part 3 – Combining functions algebraically
Need to combine functions of all types algebraically and determine domains.
